questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters uses a third-party application for credit ratings. An external web-based credit application has to be launched from a customer's account record in Salesforce. The application uses a credit ID on the account object.
What should be created to meet this requirement?

discussion.content:
D or B
A formula field using the HYPERLINK function can be used to launch an external credit application and pass the credit ID in Salesforce, so an Apex trigger is not strictly required in this scenario; however, depending on the complexity of the credit application launch process and the desired functionality, an Apex trigger might be necessary for more advanced actions or data manipulation.

Selected Answer: D
Web-based application is the key.
Option B is correct
B should be the answer, third party tool is an external app, you need apex trigger to launch any event.

Selected Answer: D
I believe "D" as a formula field hyperlink. A field by itself won't do anything to send to an external system.
Option C is the Correct Ans

Selected Answer: C
Probably C

Selected Answer: D
Correct: D

choices.B: A custom button that calls an Apex trigger to launch the credit application and pass the credit ID
choices.D: A formula field that uses the hyperlink function to launch the credit application and pass the credit ID
choices.C: A custom credit ID field as an external ID on the account to launch the credit application and pass the credit ID
choices.A: A workflow rule to launch the product fulfillment application and pass the credit ID

Opportunities. The sales representatives reported that even though the Action works well on their desktop, they cannot see the Action on their mobile app.
What is required to fix this problem?

discussion.content: Yes, I agree. It needs to be added to the page layout BUT… isn’t it the compact layout?

comments.content: If it isn't on the page layout you cannot access it from desktop, but in the scenario they could. So D is definately wrong.
I think it needs to be added to the mobile layout.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
It's should be D

Selected Answer: D
Answer should be D
D is correct

choices.D: Edit the Page Layout to include the Action.
choices.B: Edit the Visualforce to make it available for the mobile app.
choices.C: Edit the Page Layout to include a custom link to the Action.
choices.A: Edit the Action to make it available for the mobile app.

questions.question_text:
The sales director at Cloud Kicks does not want users viewing each other's Opportunities, but wants users to check to see that the Account does not already exist prior to creating a new Account.
Which Organization-Wide Default should the Consultant recommend?

discussion.content: Couldn't you use a lookup with Public Read Only?

choices.A: Set Account to Public Read Only, and Opportunity to Public Read Only.
choices.C: Set Account and Opportunity to Private.
choices.D: Set Account to Public Read Only, and Opportunity to Controlled by Parent.
choices.B: Set Account to Public Read/Write, and Opportunity to Private.
